subject: Re: [junit] Is JUnit Internationalized?
msgSnippet: ... This is an English email list??? Me cago en todo! No lo sabia! Seriously, though, I have yet to meet a programmer here in Spain that doesn t know enough
messageBody:
At 07:58 PM 08/10/01, you wrote:
>I suspect the people who would like the error messages translated won't
>be found on an English email list. Not a big deal, just something to
>consider...


This is an English email list??? Me cago en todo! No lo sabia!


Seriously, though, I have yet to meet a programmer here in Spain that
doesn't know enough English to not be able to translate the messages that
JUnit provides - simply because you need to know a minimal amount of
English to be able to program in *any* language other than assembly.


Still, if anyone wants help translating the doco into Spanish I'm willing
to _help_ (i.e. I don't have time/expertise to do it on my own...)


Jim


>- Tod
>
>Jim Cheesman wrote:
>
> >
> > I'd be inclined to agree with Vladimir - I don't think that there are
> > really enough messages within JUnit to make it that useful. (Not to mention
> > that to program in java you need to know a certain amount of English anyway
> > - all the JFCs have English names...) Of course, documentation is another
> > matter... Or is that what you are referring to?
> >
> > Jim
> >
